body:
### Summary

Currently on develop `spack install` and `spack spec` support the `--reuse` flag. `spack build-env` does not support this flag making it slightly awkward to use `spack install --reuse --only dependencies <spec>` and then `spack build-env` to get the same environment since one has to use the hash of the concretized spec instead of just using `spack build-env --reuse <spec>`.

I've seen the note in the documentation about `--reuse` becoming the default in a future version, so I'm unsure if this is an intentional or unintentional omission. If you're planning on making `--reuse` the default soon I think this is a non-issue, but wanted to report in case the omission is unintentional.

### Rationale

Convenience in using `spack install --only dependencies --reuse <spec>` together with `spack build-env <spec>`.

### Description

`spack build-env` should accept a `--reuse` flag.

### Additional information

```
> spack --version
0.17.1-1545-474493713b
```

### General information

- [X] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: `spack build-env` does not support `--reuse`
